AMOFMS

an Automated Mapping and Optimization Framework for Multiscale Simulation

AMOFMS is free software licensed under the MIT License

Overview

AMOFMS (Automated Mapping and Optimization Framework for Multiscale Simulation) is a Python-based toolkit designed to streamline and enhance multiscale simulations. By integrating advanced mapping algorithms and optimization techniques, AMOFMS automates the transition between different simulation scales, from atomic to macroscopic, making multiscale modeling more accessible and efficient. Built on top of powerful libraries like MDAnalysis, NumPy and SciPy, it offers high-performance numerical computations and is tailored for a diverse range of applications in materials science, biophysics, and engineering. Key features include automated parameter tuning, dynamic scale mapping, and optimization tools to improve simulation accuracy and performance. AMOFMS stands out for its user-friendly approach, significantly reducing the complexity and computational costs associated with multiscale simulations, making it an essential tool for researchers and engineers in the field.
